item.title: Vim
item.description: It’s hard to quit using it. But just for the first time. After notepad++ on Windows, linux terminal text editors look unusual. Nano is just simple with prompts, otherwise vim is hard to handle. First time I opened vim, I had to close terminal itself, because I didn’t realize how to quit. I watched some Sander van Vugt’s explanations on using vim, before I returned to it. And finally weeks later I revealed vim tutor, which is definitely a firm first step.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there My name is Konstantin and welcome to my personal blog! I’m glad to announce that I’ve started my fabulous DevOps path and I solemnly swear to share all useful knowledge I get on the way. For now, I’m learning Linux (RHCSA), networking (CCNA) and python. Basic stuff goes first, but I plan to gradually complicate articles (as I learn new). Hope this blog will be usuful for all of us.
